qas.question: What four topics are required in an Endangered Species Recovery Plan?

answers.text: goals, tasks required, likely costs, and estimated timeline to recover endangered species

qas.question: What is the time limit for completing an Endangered Species Recovery Plan?

answers.text: The ESA does not specify when a recovery plan must be completed.

qas.question: What Recovery Plan duration the does Fish and Wildlife Service plan for in their policies?
What is the average time of completion of an Endangered Species Recovery Plan?
Which president had the most completed Recovery Plans during their administration?
What does FWS require NMFS to create?
What length of time does the NMFS policy say plans must be completed by?
What was the average completion time for an FWS plan?
Who requires the FWS to have a completion policy?

plausible_answers.text: Fish and Wildlife Service (FWS) and National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS)

qas.question: What organizations are not required to have a recovery plan?

context: <b9_0>Fish and Wildlife Service (FWS) and National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS)<b9_0/> are required to create <b5_0>an Endangered Species Recovery Plan<b5_0/> outlining the <a0_0>goals, tasks required, likely costs, and estimated timeline to recover endangered species<a0_0/> (i.e., increase their numbers and improve their management to the point where they can be removed from the endangered list). <a1_0><b8_0>The ESA<b8_0/> does not specify when a recovery plan must be completed.<a1_0/> The FWS has a policy specifying <a2_0>completion within <b6_0>three years<b6_0/><a2_0/> of the species being listed, but the average time to completion is <a3_0>approximately <b7_0>six years<b7_0/><a3_0/>. The annual rate of recovery plan completion increased steadily from the Ford administration (4) through Carter (9), Reagan (30), Bush I (44), and <a4_0>Clinton (72)<a4_0/>, but declined under Bush II (16 per year as of 9/1/06).
